column4: as default, in recovery mode, ubuntu auto login as root, so funny, how can I make it require login?
at boot grub menu, you have option to run in recovery mode, it auto login as root, and you can do anything with root, without a passwords, how can I make ubuntu request login?

yes, why do you want it to request a password?  Anyone with physical access can do whatever they want anyway.  If you set a root password, it will prompt for that password.  But you can edit the grub menu too by pressing 'e' and then get to a shell with root permissions anyway.  If you stop that, then you can put a live cd in your drive and do wahtever you want.
